text: What's up outliers, a quick GME update, keeping the cadence alive here. This should be a fast one because well, a couple of things happened, but none of it is super great in my opinion, unfortunately. So we did see GameStop have a fair down day, 5 down. And it hovered right around 22 and a half ish right now. After hours, it's at 22 54 by 58. And we have now fallen below at least what I viewed as some near term support. So now the question becomes in my opinion, how far down does it go? You can already see from the recent conversation we have, this would be the next target. I see online, which would be about 21. And that's just trying to find where people are transacting in the stock. But unfortunately, you can see here that this is where it corresponds on the volume node about right there. And the volume node just wanes. And this is where it's actually the lightest, which is at like 18 and a half. So what that tells me unless buyers step in in some sort of really meaningful way, I wouldn't be overly surprised if the selling continued is really opposed down to as much as I don't like saying that. It's something that I'll do at a ratio to never cap the upside potential, but it allows me to handle smaller downsides like this. So that's what I'm seeing today.
